settings.title: Haus has found the solution I didn’t really know I was looking for!
I love the flavor of this apéritif — it’s light and lively, and it’s refreshing with seltzer or tonic.
It’s delicious, and unique. I love everything from the packaging, to the flavors.
Handmade in Sonoma County with farm-to-bottle ingredients.
settings.copy:
Haus was launched on a farm in Sonoma County in 2019, and we still hold our products to the highest values and standards. We source all of our ingredients from farms we trust, as well as top purveyors who supply Michelin-Starred restaurants.

We leave out the fake flavors and preservatives that you find in our competition. We care deeply about our craft, and it’s a difference you can taste.

settings.title: "What makes Haus so special is its incredible flavors."
“For the wine or cocktail lover who’s tried it all and wants something new and refreshing.”
“Cleaner, responsibly sourced, and lower in alcohol.”
An intro to apéritifs
settings.copy: Apéritifs are a category of spirits with complex flavors derived from fruits, herbs, and botanicals. Their lighter alcohol content (less than whiskey, more than wine) makes them perfect to sip all evening.

settings.title: What is Haus, anyway?
settings.answer:
Haus is a beverage brand creating better products for the modern drinker. The alcohol industry hasn’t changed in 100 years, so we decided to redesign how it works — from the ingredients we use, to the way we sell our products directly to you.

We’ve started with a line of apéritifs. They’re created with only natural fruits, herbs, and botanicals, and are low-ABV (alcohol by volume) in keeping with apéritif tradition. All of our products are crafted by our team in Sonoma, CA, and we make our processes transparent so you know exactly what you’re drinking.

We’re just getting started, so sign up for our newsletter to be the first to know about future products.

settings.title: What exactly is an apéritif?
settings.answer-html:
Apéritifs are a category of spirits with complex flavors that typically come from fruits, herbs, roots and botanicals. They’ve been a big part of European drinking culture for centuries, and they’re becoming more popular in America now too.

They’re low-ABV (less alcohol than whiskey, more than wine), which makes them perfect for enjoying throughout the evening on the rocks or with simple mixers like soda or tonic.

settings.title: What does an apéritif taste like?
settings.answer-html:
Aperitifs can taste like all kinds of things. In fact, you’ve probably had an apéritif before and didn’t know it. If you’ve had Campari, an Aperol Spritz, a martini or manhattan, you’ve had an apéritif.

Most apéritifs have a complex, herbaceous taste because they’re made with fruits and botanicals. Some of them are very bitter, and some are very sweet.

We’re a bit biased, but they're really, really good.

Our products are inspired by European apéritifs, but they’re designed for the American palate. Our first apéritif, Citrus Flower, tastes like — you guessed it — citrus and flowers, while New Fashioned —inspired by amaro and whiskey — is earthy and herbaceous.

They're not bitter, and have a fraction of the sugar of similar apéritifs. Each of our apéritifs are complex and sophisticated, with flavor notes coming from a variety of real fruits, herbs, and botanicals in the bottle.

settings.title: Where is Haus made?
settings.answer: Haus is made in Sonoma County, California. Our team blends and bottles each bottle of Haus at our warehouse, not too far from our farm in Healdsburg. Then we box it up and ship it to your door.  We oversee every part of the process, from start to finish.

settings.title: Wait, how do you say Haus?
settings.answer-html: Don't worry, we get this question a lot. Haus is pronounced "house."

settings.title: How come I've never seen liquor for sale online before?
settings.answer:
Long story short, it’s mostly illegal. Alcohol laws haven’t really changed in almost 100 years, a time long before the Internet came around. They have a lot of catching up to do.

Believe it or not, we’re the first company to do this. Ever.

Because we’re an apéritif and under 24% alcohol (our apéritifs range from 15-20% ABV), we can legally bypass most of the federal restrictions on spirits and sell directly to your door. We can also open our own retail shops and bars (stay tuned).

settings.title: Why are you choosing to sell online instead of going through traditional distributors like other alcohol brands?
settings.answer:
Our biggest reason — we want a relationship with our customer. If we went through traditional distribution, we’d no longer know who is telling our story and how we’re being served. We’d never get to meet the person drinking us. That just feels wrong.

By selling directly to the drinker, we get to build real relationships with our community and get direct feedback that we can use to build better products. It’s a win for all of us.

settings.title: How can I stay up to date on new products and releases?
settings.answer: Sign up for our newsletter at the bottom of this page, or follow us on Instagram or Twitter.

settings.title: When will my order ship?
settings.answer-html:
Due to the busy holiday season, orders placed with standard Ground shipping will ship in 2 to 5 business days. Once your order ships, it should arrive within 5 to 7 business days.

If you want to get your order faster (we get it!), we also offer expedited and overnight options. All express orders will ship in 1 to 2 business days.

Business days are Monday through Friday, excluding holidays.

Note: Third party items, such as glassware or bar carts, will ship separately from your Haus bottles or kits, typically within 5 business days.

settings.title: When should I order for delivery by Christmas or New Year's Eve?
settings.answer-html:
It's sure to be a busy shipping season, so we recommend ordering well in advance to ensure your order arrives in time.

For delivery by December 24th, place your order by the following deadlines:
  • For standard Ground shipping, order by 11:59pm PT on Sunday, December 12
  • For express shipping, order by 11:59pm PT on Thursday, December 16

For delivery by December 31st, place your order by the following deadlines:
  • For standard Ground shipping, order by 11:59pm PT on Sunday, December 19
  • For express shipping, order by 11:59pm PT on Monday, December 27

settings.title: Where does Haus ship?
settings.answer-html:
We ship to many of the 50 states in the USA but still waiting on Alabama, Alaska, Arkansas, Delaware, Hawaii, Indiana, Kansas, Mississippi, Montana, Rhode Island, South Carolina, Utah, Vermont, Wisconsin, and West Virginia but we hope to have them on board soon.

Right now, we only ship within the contiguous United States. Eventually, we hope to be shipped across the world. If you want Haus in your country, we'd love to hear from you. Message us on Twitter or Instagram.

settings.title: Do I need to sign for my order?
settings.answer-html:
Yes. Bummer we know, but it's the law. However, another adult can sign for you -- so if it's going somewhere with a receptionist (like your office) or a doorman (like your apartment building) you're all set. Otherwise, make sure you or someone over 21 is home on the day it's supposed to arrive. As an additional security measure, FedEx may also require the scanning of a valid government-issued ID at time of delivery.

If you fear you may miss your delivery, don't worry -- you may redirect your package to a nearby hold location or start a vacation hold. You can get this set up right from your FedEx tracking page."

settings.title: Can I ship to a PO Box?
settings.answer-html: Afraid not. Because Haus is alcohol, it can only be shipped to a residential or business address.

settings.title: Do you offer Saturday delivery?
settings.answer-html: FedEx offers Saturday delivery in most areas, just as long as your order is shipped to a residential address. We cannot guarantee Expedited or Overnight shipping will deliver on a Saturday if you're shipping to a business address.

settings.title: How much does shipping cost?
settings.answer-html:
We offer free FedEx ground shipping on all orders over $50. Ground shipping is just $7 for any order under $50.

We also offer FedEx Expedited (2-Day) and FedEx Overnight shipping. These prices are calculated at checkout.

settings.title: Can I get my order through local delivery?
settings.answer-html:
If you live in Los Angeles, San Francisco or surrounding areas, you sure can.

We currently offer our full size (750ml) bottles for local delivery through our partner Ohi. If your zip code is within the local delivery range, and your local Ohi warehouse has all the items in your cart in stock, you will see options for local delivery at check out. We currently offer rush (2 hour) delivery, same day delivery or next day delivery, depending on your zip code and the current time of day. We hope to roll this out for more cities in the future.

settings.title: How do local same day or next day deliveries work?
settings.answer-html:
If your address is eligible for local delivery and your nearby Ohi warehouse has all your items in stock, you'll have the option to select either Rush (2 hour) Delivery, Same Day Delivery or Next Day Delivery by Ohi during checkout. Once you complete your order, you will receive a text message with your Ohi tracking information.

Note: Gift notes are not available with local delivery, and bottles are delivered in kraft paper tote bags, rather than our shipping boxes, to conserve paper.

Order deadlines for eligible zip codes:
  • Same Day Delivery: Same day orders placed before 5pm PT will be delivered between 6pm and 8pm PT. If you order after 5pm PT, your order will be delivered the following day between 6pm and 8pm. Same day orders may also be rescheduled for delivery on a later date via the Ohi tracking link.
  • Rush (2 hour) Delivery: Rush delivery is available for orders placed until 6pm, and your order will arrive to your doorstep in the next two hours.
  • Next Day Delivery: Orders made before 4pm will be delivered the following day between 10am and 8pm.

settings.title: How much does local delivery cost?
settings.answer-html: Local delivery by Ohi to locations in and around San Francisco and Los Angeles is just $7 per order.

settings.title: How do I drink Haus?
settings.answer: We suggest drinking Haus like you'd drink any other spirit -- straight on the rocks, with soda or tonic, or in a simple cocktail, like a spritz.

settings.title: How should I store Haus?
settings.answer-html: We recommend storing Haus in a cool, dark place like your countertop, bookshelf or bar cart.

settings.title: How many drinks does a bottle make?
settings.answer-html: Our 750ml bottles serve about 10-12 drinks, depending on your pour. Our 200ml bottles serve about 2-3 drinks each.

settings.title: How do you make Haus?
settings.answer-html:
We source each ingredient from farms we trust (including our own) as well as from purveyors who supply Michelin-starred restaurants.

To make Haus we steep whole fruits, herbs, and botanicals in brandy to extract their flavor. Then we blend our extractions into naturally fermented and distilled grapes, along with a small amount of raw organic cane sugar for stability and texture. Because we use fresh fruits, herbs, and botanicals, you may taste very subtle differences from batch to batch.

Our team creates Haus at our warehouse, right down the road from our farm. Then we bottle and ship it directly to your door.

settings.title: Does Haus contain gluten or dairy?
settings.answer: Haus is gluten free and vegan. All of our products are free of gluten, dairy, lactose, and casein. If you're interested in learning more about what's inside each bottle, you can find detailed nutrition and ingredient info on each product page, too.

settings.title: Is Haus organic?
settings.answer-html: Haus isn't certified organic, but we work hard to use organic fruits, herbs, and botanicals as often as possible. For complete information on our ingredients, click the "Ingredients + Nutrition" link on our product pages.

settings.title: Are there any allergens in Haus?
settings.answer-html:
None of our products contain allergens like eggs or shellfish. However, we do use coconut in Peach Passionfruit, which is a tree nut, and pink peppercorn in Grapefruit Jalapeño, which is in the cashew family.

If you have a known allergy, we recommend checking the ingredient lists on each product page to make sure you're in the clear, as we use fruits, herbs and botanicals in every aperitif.

settings.title: Does Haus contain sulfites?
settings.answer-html: We don’t add any sulfur (or any other preservatives for that matter) in our production process. Our wine base contains a small amount of sulfites that occur from fermentation.

settings.title: Can sediment occur in Haus?
settings.answer-html: We only use real fruits, herbs and botanicals to make Haus, so you may see some naturally occurring sediment in your bottle from time to time. If you're a natural wine drinker, this will look familiar. Rest assured, your Haus is still a-okay to enjoy.

settings.title: Where does the color in Haus come from?
settings.answer-html: The color in our aperitifs comes from the fruits, herbs, and botanicals that we use to make them. We don’t use any artificial colors - what you see is allllll natural.

settings.title: Are you going to release any non-alcoholic products?
settings.answer: It's definitely something we're thinking about. Subscribe to our newsletter here to be first to know about them.

settings.title: Do I need to be 21 years old to buy Haus?
settings.answer: Yep you do. The law's the law, even on the Internet.

settings.title: What's your return policy?
settings.answer-html:
If you place an order directly from our website and are not a fan of our products, you may reach out within 30 days of purchase and we will issue you a refund.

If you purchase Haus from a retail shop, returns are subject to their individual store policies.

settings.title: How much does Haus Membership cost?
settings.answer: Haus Membership pricing is based on the traditional wine club model. There is no cost to join, and all you pay is a discounted price on your bottle allotment.

settings.title: What's included with a Haus Membership?
settings.answer:
Haus Membership includes a discounted monthly shipment of your favorite Haus apéritifs, as well as access to members-only events and exclusive flavor releases. Membership is available in three tiers, starting at $40 per month:

One Bottle
• 1 bottle per month
• Free shipping on all orders
• Access to exclusive apéritifs
• $40 per month

Two Bottles
• 2 bottles per month
• 10% off all orders
• Free shipping on all orders
• Early access to exclusive apéritifs
• $72 per month

Six Bottles
• 6 bottles per month
• 20% off all orders
• Free shipping on all orders
• First access to exclusive apéritifs
• $192 per month

settings.title: Will I receive a different flavor every month?
settings.answer: While Membership isn't designed to auto-rotate flavors each month, you're able to swap out your monthly flavor selection as much as you'd like. You can change your flavor(s) allocation in your Membership settings. Don't worry, we send you a monthly email reminding you to do this before we ship!

settings.title: How do I access my membership settings?
settings.answer: First step: create an online account with us. When you login, you’ll be able to access all membership settings and exclusives.

settings.title: When will my membership bottle(s) ship?
settings.answer: Your membership begins the day you sign up, so you'll receive your first monthly shipment within 3-5 days and immediately have access to events and flavor exclusives. Your membership cycle is determined by the day you sign up, so if you sign up on the 5th, you'll always be billed and receive your monthly bottles within 3-5 days of that date.
settings.answer-html: Your membership begins the day you sign up, so you'll immediately have access to perks and flavor exclusives, and your first monthly order will ship within 1 to 3 business days. Your membership cycle is determined by the day you sign up, so if you sign up on the 5th, you'll always be billed on that date with your bottle(s) shipping out in 1 to 3 business days from then.

settings.title: Can I change my membership payment method?
settings.answer: Of course! Simply edit or add a new card when you are logged into your Haus account.

settings.title: How do I change my membership tier?
settings.answer: Want more (or less) bottles each month? Send us an email at hello@drink.haus and we’ll get it taken care of.

settings.title: How do I change my selection?
settings.answer: Easy! You can change the specific apéritif(s) you want in your next shipment by emailing us at hello@drink.haus. Just make sure to make any updates 3 business days before your designated charge date.

settings.title: What if I only want limited edition apéritifs?
settings.answer: We're flexible, so you're welcome to become a member and leave at any point. By becoming a member, you're committing to at least one month of whichever core flavor and bottle allocation you select. If you happen to join when we're launching a members-only flavor, then you're in luck. You'll have the opportunity to purchase that limited edition flavor in addition to your monthly allocation.

settings.title: Can I pause or cancel my membership?
settings.answer: We get it, life happens. You can cancel your membership at any time, and rejoin when the time is right. There’s no fee to cancel or (re)join. Please be sure to make any updates to your membership 3 business days prior to your designated charge date.

settings.title: How sustainable is Haus?
settings.answer-html:
Sustainability is core to our beliefs as a business.

Our production is powered by 100% clean, renewable energy from The Geysers, a local geothermal power source.

Our materials are sourced responsibly with care for forest conservation throughout the supply chain. Our boxes are made from up to 90% recycled material and are 100% recyclable. The material used that is not from recycled material is a byproduct of milling operations that would otherwise be considered waste.

Our ingredients are responsibly sourced from farmers and purveyors we know and trust. The raw fruits, herbs, and botanicals we use to create Haus are composted once we've extracted their flavors, leaving very little waste.

settings.title: Where can I try Haus in person?
settings.answer-html: We're starting to pop up on the menus and shelves of our favorites bars, restaurants, and retailers in California, and look forward to hosting events around the country again soon as well. If you're looking for Haus in a particular city in California, email us at hello@drink.haus and we'll help you out. And you can sign up for our newsletter to be first to know about upcoming events.

settings.title: Can I place a corporate gifting or wholesale order?
settings.answer-html:
Definitely! To place a gifting order for your team, check out our Corporate Gifting page to get started. We'll help take care of the rest.

For wholesale orders, we currently offer wholesale pricing for licensed bars, restaurants and retailers. Just shoot us an email at wholesale@drink.haus and we'll put together a custom order for you.

settings.title: How can I get in touch?
settings.answer:
Depending on what you're looking for, here's the best way to reach out:

For press inquiries: press@drink.haus 
For business or wholesale inquiries: partnerships@drink.haus
 For any other questions: hello@drink.haus

settings.title: Are your bottles recyclable?
settings.answer: Yep, our bottles are 100% recyclable. We like to upcycle them too. Try repurposing them for candles, flowers, oil or vinegar, or cocktail syrups.

settings.title: FAQ
settings.copy: If you have any questions or want to learn more about us, check out the FAQ below or write to us directly at hello@drink.haus.

settings.title: We wanted a better drink
settings.copy:
It all started with alcohol, an industry that hasn’t evolved since prohibition. It’s still ruled by huge liquor companies that spend big to get their products on store shelves and in bars. And you’re stuck with their choices. Sketchy ingredients, too much alcohol, outdated aesthetics, and too many hangovers. 

Something needed to change, and we knew alcohol could be different. Like food, it can come from organic farms, not factories. It can be created naturally with real fruits and botanicals, not artificial flavors. And it can be accessible.

settings.title: A new type of alcohol brand
settings.copy:
We’re doing everything differently than corporate liquor - starting with ingredients. We source the highest quality fruits, herbs, and botanicals from trusted farmers and purveyors who supply Michelin-star restaurants. 

Our team blends every bottle at our warehouse in Sonoma County, and ships straight to you in packaging made from recycled materials.

We include nutrition facts and complete ingredient lists for every product, because we believe you deserve to know what’s in your glass.

settings.title: A drink you can feel good about
settings.copy: We all care more about what we put in our bodies now. The alcohol we drink should follow the same rules. Our product is farm-to-bottle with only real ingredients - no sketchy additives.  Here are a few of the ingredients we use to make our apéritifs.

settings.title: From our Haus to yours
settings.copy:
We’re a third generation winemaking family who realized the alcohol industry wasn’t doing right by our generation. We knew spirits could be better — made with whole ingredients and nothing fake.

So we made our own apéritifs, designed for the modern drinker. We make our products with real fruits, herbs, and botanicals, and blend, bottle, and ship them to you straight from Sonoma County.

settings.title: An Intro to Haus
settings.copy:
Each Haus apéritif is unique and complex, lower in alcohol, and ideal to sip for any occasion. We make our apéritifs with only real ingredients, so there's no wrong choice.

Their lighter alcohol (half of what you find in traditional liquor) makes them perfect to sip all evening without the blur in the morning.

settings.hero-text: Set your bar higher this year.
settings.copy: Farm-to-bottle aperitifs, delivered to your door.

settings.title: A modern spin on the apéritif
settings.copy:
While newer to the States, apéritifs have been popular in Europe for centuries. They have the flavor complexity of a cocktail, but are low enough in alcohol content (stronger than wine, lighter than whiskey) that you can enjoy them in a cocktail, without the consequences.

Our apéritifs take a modern approach, for something fresh, clean, and easy to drink.

settings.title: What are Apéritifs?
settings.copy: Apéritifs are a category of spirits with complex flavors derived from fruits, herbs, and botanicals. Their lighter alcohol content (less than whiskey, more than wine) makes them perfect to sip all evening.

settings.title: Let them choose
settings.description: Our digital gift cards are the perfect way to say happy holidays, sent straight to their inbox.

settings.title: Cocktail Kit Gifts
settings.copy: Shop our cocktail kits with over 1,000 5-star reviews and loved by the New York Times, Bon Appétit, and GQ. We're Haus, alcohol with less sugar, real ingredients, and delicious flavors on their own or perfect in a cocktail.
